articles.title: Trump Administration Said to Discuss Taking Stake in Intel - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: The Trump administration is in talks with Intel Corp. to have the US government take a stake in the beleaguered chipmaker, according to people familiar with the plan, in the latest sign of the White House’s willingness to blur the lines between state and indu…

articles.title: China’s Economy Slows Sharply as Trade War Bites - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: China’s economy slowed across the board in July with factory activity, investment and retail sales disappointing, suggesting Beijing’s crackdown on destructive price wars and spillovers from Donald Trump’s tariffs are casting a pall over the world’s No. 2 eco…

articles.title: Costco will not sell abortion pills after pressure from conservatives - The Washington Post
articles.description: The grocery giant was pressured by antiabortion groups not to carry mifepristone as medication abortion gains popularity in the U.S.

articles.title: Warren Buffett just revealed some of his final stock picks as Berkshire CEO - Business Insider
articles.description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway built a $1.6 billion stake in UnitedHealth last quarter, marking one of its last wagers with the investor as CEO.

articles.title: Japan's economy expands more than expected in second quarter as net exports remain resilient - CNBC
articles.description: This was compared to the revised 0.1% growth seen in the first quarter, and was higher than the 0.1% increase expected by economists polled by Reuters.

articles.title: CBS News poll finds tipping expectations have grown - CBS News
articles.description: A majority of Americans say they feel expectations for tipping have grown in recent years.

articles.title: Partnership to end: Popular retailer to exit Target stores next year - OregonLive.com
articles.description: The collaboration with Target began in 2021 and included several Portland-area locations.

articles.title: Air Canada starts canceling flights ahead of work stoppage that could impact hundreds of thousands - AP News
articles.description: Air Canada has started canceling flights ahead of a possible work stoppage by flight attendants that could impact hundreds of thousands of travelers. A complete shutdown of the country’s largest airline threatens to impact about 130,000 travelers a day. The u…

articles.title: Average 30-year U.S. mortgage rate drops to lowest level since October - PBS
articles.description: The long-term rate fell to 6.58% from 6.63% last week, mortgage buyer Freddie Mac said Thursday. A year ago, the rate averaged 6.49%.

articles.title: For Just $1 Million, Wealthy Investors Can Buy a Stake in Hedge Fund Millennium - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: For just $1 million, investors are being offered a slice of one of the world’s largest hedge fund firms.

articles.title: Most US stocks fall after a disappointing inflation update, but Big Tech keeps Wall Street steady - AP News
articles.description: Most stocks fell on Wall Street following a disappointing update on inflation. But gains for Amazon and other influential Big Tech companies helped mask the losses on Thursday, and the S&P 500 edged up by less than 0.1% to set another all-time high. The Dow J…

articles.title: Inflation or jobs: Federal Reserve officials are divided over competing concerns - AP News
articles.description: Federal Reserve policymakers will be debating whether stubborn inflation or slower hiring is the bigger problem for the economy as they prepare for an annual conference in Jackson, Wyoming, next week and a crucial policy meeting in September. Weak job gains s…

articles.title: Applied Materials Stock Drops On Weak Outlook. CEO Sees 'Increased Uncertainty.' - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Applied Materials beat Wall Street's targets for its fiscal third quarter but badly missed with its outlook. Applied Materials stock fell.

articles.title: US Stocks Fall as Hotter-Than-Expected PPI Halts Record Run - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: US stocks managed to overcome a hotter-than-expected wholesale inflation reading on Thursday to notch another record high.

articles.title: Starlink tries to block Virginia’s plan to bring fiber Internet to residents - Ars Technica
articles.description: SpaceX wants more money, asks Trump admin to reject state’s broadband grant plan.

articles.title: Sarepta Sells Arrowhead Stake To Stretch Its Cash Runway; And One Stock Dives - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Arrowhead Pharmaceuticals stock tumbled Thursday after Sarepta Therapeutics liquified its entire stake in the company.

articles.title: Trump’s ‘Ice Maiden’ Shows Laura Loomer Who’s in Charge - The Daily Beast

articles.title: AI experts return from China stunned: The U.S. grid is so weak, the race may already be over - Fortune
articles.description: China is “set up to hit grand slams,” longtime Chinese energy expert David Fishman told Fortune. “The U.S., at best, can get on base.”
